posts.title: Myeongdong Vibes! Live Cafe Tempting Day Drinkers
posts.content:
Okay, so today I'm gonna introduce you to a place with amazing vibes â€“ it's a live cafe and bar! 
It's Friday night, but I can't drink... ğŸ˜­ (tears)

"No-alcohol Friday night" is kinda sad, but I gotta heal with the atmosphere! The interior design is super artsy and I totally loved it.

The fact that they have live music performances is really attractive. Listening to music with a drink in the evening would be so stress-relieving! (But I'm not drinking...)
I definitely wanna visit again at night and have a drink next time! ğŸ»

If you're looking for a place with a good vibe in Myeongdong, I totally recommend this place! 
It's good for both lunch and dinner, so give it a try. ğŸ˜‰

posts.title: Free Burger at Myeongdong McDonald's - So Delicious!ğŸ˜‹
posts.content:
Hey everyone! Myeongdong office worker here. I'm back with another delicious lunch adventure! Today I went to a really special place(?).

I bet you already know from the picture, right? It's McDonald's! ğŸ¤£ I think it might be the most popular McDonald's in the whole country. Since it's right in the middle of Myeongdong... ahem.

Today's order was the Bacon Tomato Deluxe Burger set!
I added coleslaw and also got an iced Americano.

The burger was sweet for my taste, the coleslaw was tangy, and the iced Americano... was a little small! LOL. But it tasted amazing because it was a free burger.

Honestly, you all know what McDonald's tastes like, but it's perfect for a quick and cheap lunch in Myeongdong! I should visit Myeongdong McDonald's once in a while. ğŸ˜‰

posts.title: Another Beer Today. Different Carlsberg This Time.
posts.content:
On my way home from work, I found myself in front of the beer fridge, like always.

Instead of my usual beer, I felt like trying something different today.

Carlsberg? It's the Danish Royal beer, right? I guess it feels kinda fancy, or maybe that's just me.

The moment I opened the can, a slightly bitter yet refreshing scent tickled my nose.

Well, I worked hard today. This is like a small reward for myself. Gotta keep going tomorrow!

posts.title: Myeongdong Office Worker's Pick! Dimdimsum - My Second Visit This Week!
posts.content:
Hi everyone! I'm a 40-something office worker in Myeongdong, always on the hunt for great lunch spots. 

Today, I'm introducing a place I've already visited twice this week! That means it's definitely perfect for my taste, right?

There's usually a little wait during lunchtime, but you can save time by deciding what to eat while looking at the menu! They have a variety of noodles and rice dishes, and the prices aren't too bad considering Myeongdong prices. Today, after thinking about what to eat, I decided to definitely order the Xiaolongbao, which I enjoyed last time! Oh, I was so focused on eating that I forgot to take pictures. ã… ã…  It's already in my stomach, what can I do... I guess I'll have to eat it again next time.

Today, I ordered the roast duck rice bowl along with the Xiaolongbao. The glossy roast duck was piled high on top of the rice, and the visuals were perfect! The sweet and savory sauce and the tender roast duck were a fantastic combination. I scraped every last grain of rice clean.

There are many people eating alone today, and it's also good to come with colleagues and order several dishes to share. The clean atmosphere is also a plus, making it a comfortable place to eat during lunchtime! If you want to have a delicious lunch in Myeongdong, give it a try!

posts.title: Scored Carlsberg Stuff! Fangirling is the Best Small Happiness
posts.content:
CATEGORY: diary

On my way home from work, I did my usual thing and opened the CU app... and saw the Carlsberg Liverpool glass package for pre-order! As soon as I saw it, I knew I had to buy it. I've been a KOP (Liverpool fan) for over 10 years, so I can't resist things like this.

What's life all about anyway? It's about having a beer after work and getting energized while looking at your favorite team's merch. My paycheck might disappear, but my heart feels full of magic!

Sometimes, these small moments of happiness are what make working at a company worthwhile. Long live fangirling! Long live Carlsberg! Let's go Liverpool, win the championship!

Carlsberg Liverpool Glass Package

posts.title: Myeongdong Lunch Automation, Finally Did It!
posts.content:
I finally completed my automation pipeline for Myeongdong local lunch blog posts! Can you feel the power of vibe coding? Now, just a few pictures and a sentence or two, and bam! A post is done. 

Before, I had to open map apps, take pictures of the menu, compare prices... just thinking about it makes me shiver. Trying to squeeze it in after work wasn't easy. Now, the AI does it for me, and it's so convenient. 

Of course, there are probably still many things to improve. But isn't this why we code? (If you have a lunch appointment in Myeongdong... hit me up... gotta collect more data... cough cough)

posts.title: KEPCO Cafeteria: A Delicious Meal for Only 6,000 Won! ğŸ˜‹
posts.content:
Lunchtime! Where should I go today? ğŸ¤” I'm tired of eating the same food every day, so I decided to try the KEPCO cafeteria! ğŸ¤­ I've heard rumors that the food here is really good. And I found out that outsiders can eat here too! ğŸ˜

It's located on the first basement floor of the Korea Electric Power Corporation building. And guess what? There's a model of old Seoul in the lobby on the first floor! ğŸ˜² It was fun looking at the miniatures. (But the scale seems a little off... ğŸ¤£)

Okay, finally got my meal ticket! Only 6,000 won for sea tangle rice, soybean paste soup, seaweed, kimchi, salad, and flat meat patty! Isn't that awesome?! ğŸ‘ The sea tangle rice was chewy and delicious, and the soybean paste soup was perfect. The side dishes were also neat and good!ğŸ’¯

Honestly, I didn't expect much from a company cafeteria, but it was surprisingly spacious and clean. There were a lot of people eating alone, so I could enjoy my meal without feeling awkward. ğŸ˜Œ However, it gets super crowded during lunchtime! I recommend going before 12 o'clock! ğŸ™

In conclusion! This quality for 6,000 won is a total steal! I'll definitely come here often. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable lunch in Myeongdong! ğŸ¤—

posts.title: Myeongdong Dimdimsum: 10% Off! Wonton Noodle Soup Review
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch
RESTAURANT: Dimdimsum Myeongdong
RESTAURANT_ADDRESS: B1 Floor, Noon Square, 83-5 Myeongdong 2(i)-ga, Jung-gu, Seoul
RESTAURANT_PLACE_ID: dimdimsum
VISIT_COUNT: 1

As a 40-something office worker who's always thinking about where to go for lunch, that's me! Today, I went to 'Dimdimsum' in Myeongdong, which is famous for its dim sum. Guess what? I got a 10% discount coupon! I couldn't miss this chance, so I rushed over there. ğŸ˜

Thanks to the coupon, I ordered some dishes that I usually find a bit pricey. This is what I call a small flex, right? ğŸ˜† Dimdimsum tastes almost exactly like the dim sum I had in Hong Kong, so it's perfect for when I'm missing Hong Kong. The atmosphere is clean and spacious, making it easy to have a comfortable lunch.

I ordered the Wonton Noodle Soup and Shrimp and Chives Dumplings! The Wonton Noodle Soup had a really refreshing broth and the noodles were so chewy, I slurped it all up. The Shrimp and Chives Dumplings were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside - so delicious! But be careful, the freshly made dumplings are super hot. ğŸ”¥ I almost burned my mouthâ€¦ ğŸ˜…

The prices are a bit high, but the 10% discount made it much more affordable. I recommend Dimdimsum if you want to eat dim sum in Myeongdong! Especially when you have a discount coupon, definitely go. ğŸ¤© It's near Myeongdong Station, so the location is great! I fully recharged with delicious dim sum during lunch! Look forward to my next restaurant exploration~ ğŸ˜Š

posts.title: Apink, Still There Like Time Stopped
posts.content:
Apink is still performing? Wow, that's surprising! 

Seeing them on Open Concert right now, it's really them. 

I started reminiscing about the old days without even realizing it... guess I'm getting old. 

Time flies so fast, but it's amazing and even makes me feel thankful that someone is still the same as they were back then. 

Thanks to them, I had a nice trip down memory lane. Gotta live my life to the fullest today too!

To everyone going to work tomorrow, let's all hang in there! 
Let's at least finish today happily.

This is totally a new world.

posts.title: S'more? What's That, Food?
posts.content:
I just learned about something called a s'more today. Apparently, it's an American camping dessert. AI told me about it.

So, you roast a marshmallow and sandwich it between chocolate and crackers. It doesn't seem like much, but I bet it would taste amazing if you ate it while camping.

Finding out about new things is fun, and that's another small joy in life.

Ugh, whatever. I'm just gonna go home and grab a beer.

posts.title: OpenAI's Downfall? I'm Starting to Feel It.
posts.content:
OpenAI used to be like, the icon of innovation, right? But these days, I'm definitely using ChatGPT less often.

I tried out Gemini and Claude, and they're pretty good. Especially Claude, it seems to have a real strength in writing.

Tech changes are always unpredictable, you know? But thanks to that, it's fun learning new tools.

I gotta do Vibe Coding and learn AI tools too. Late 40s and still got a lot to learn, haha.

posts.title: Another Late Night at Work: Early Exit is a Myth...
posts.content:
Another day, another late night leaving the office. 
When will I ever get to leave on time? 
It's like the amount of work magically increases right before quitting time, right? You all know what I'm talking about!

I'm not the only one dealing with this, am I? Hang in there, everyone! 
Make sure to eat dinner, okay?

posts.title: It's Dangerous Outside the Blanket, But I Still Gotta Go to Work
posts.content:
Winter mornings are the best inside the blanket, right? It's warm and cozy, like the perfect escape. 

My eyes feel heavy, and my brain's screaming 'Just five more minutes!', but my body already knows the cruel reality: I have to go to work. 

The moment I kick off the blanket, a freezing wind will slap my face... but what can I do? Gotta make a living.

posts.title: So, This Is Why People Do Vibe Coding?
posts.content:
To be honest, I got teased a bit for doing "vibe coding." An old guy who's been just saying hi for over 10 years suddenly coding? Tsk tsk. 

But you know what? It's surprisingly fun. Nothing too fancy, but I'm writing scripts to automate Excel stuff and making simple web pages.

Things I never even imagined before are happening right in front of me. It's like a whole new world. Now I won't starve even after I retire... right? Maybe I'll make something and sell it. Hehe.

But hey, at least one day is down, right? Let's wash it all away with a beer after work!

Gonna code with Vibe and blow off some steam. Although, I guess that's just an extension of work... ğŸ˜…

posts.title: Ode to Frozen Pizza
posts.content:
I baked a frozen pizza, and wow, times have really changed. The quality is almost restaurant-level now. 

Getting an oven at home has really improved my quality of life. No need to order expensive pizzas anymore, I can just crack open a beer and enjoy some me-time. Isn't this the definition of simple joys?

Sometimes, a conveniently-made frozen pizza is more comforting than a perfect meal.

posts.title: Calling Out Those Names Again
posts.content:
Jeon Tae-il, Park Jong-cheol, Lee Han-yeol... Just hearing their names brings a lump to my throat.

In times when making ends meet was a struggle, they gave their all for a better world. Thanks to them, we can now work in a slightly better environment.

Sometimes, when I complain about suffocating late-night work, their sacrifices come to mind. I should spend today with a grateful heart, striving to make the world a little better.

Does that sound like something an old-timer would say? Well, I can't help it. I guess I'm getting old. Heh heh.

posts.title: A Tequila Shot on a Sorry Night
posts.content:
Last night, I finally cracked open that tequila I'd been saving. To be honest, it was a bottle I'd been cherishing. I've been so caught up in vibe coding lately that I haven't taken my wife out on a proper date. Feeling guilty, I decided to take the plunge and open it. 

Sitting across from her, sipping our drinks after so long, I felt a pang of regret for the time I'd neglected her. Coding is great, but it's clear that the person beside me is the most important thing.

posts.title: InterContinental Danang Long Bar: An Extravagant Pint of Ale
posts.content:
Sipping on a cold ale at the InterContinental Danang Long Bar completely washed away all my worries.

Of course, the price was quite evil... ğŸ˜‚ Thinking about my empty bank account almost brought a tear to my eye, but I'll consider it an investment in myself for working hard today.

posts.title: Finally! Images are Now Supported!
posts.content:
The Cheer Factory blog finally has image upload capabilities! Hooray! It's not a huge change, but it's a pretty significant step for me. 

I've only been able to write text until now, but I can finally tell more diverse stories. Since it's a feature created by a coding newbie after a lot of trial and error, it might be a little clumsy... but please be understanding. I'm planning to share snippets of my daily life and insights, often with photos. You can look forward to it! (Oh, and don't expect super high-resolution images, though. ğŸ˜…)

posts.title: Starting My Second Act: A Dutch Coffee Business with My Daughter?
posts.content:
Planning to make and sell Dutch coffee with my daughter. A 50/50 profit split! Haha, perfectly fair. 

Raising her is already a lot of fun, but now she's my business partner too. It's incredibly moving. But... already getting bombarded with nagging: 'Dad, you gotta do marketing like this!'

Still, it's great. The small joy of brewing coffee with my daughter after work. Is this what they call work-life balance...?

(Scratching head) It'd be great if it works out, but if it doesn't, well, it'll be life experience, right?

posts.title: The Significance of a Sunday Morning Coffee
posts.content:
There are those weekend mornings when you'd love to sleep in, but your body decides otherwise. After a bit of lazy lingering, you eventually head out for a cup of coffee. There's something quite enjoyable about watching the small groups of people gathered at the local cafe, each absorbed in their own little world.

It's a familiar scene, but it exudes a sense of calm that's absent during the weekday hustle. Taking a sip of warm coffee inexplicably makes my heart feel all soft and fuzzy.

Isn't this what they call simple happiness? It's just a mundane Sunday morning routine, but it gives me the strength to get through the week. It's not as thrilling as, say, vibe coding, but hey, this is what makes life worth living.

posts.title: A Cloudy Day
posts.content:
I woke up this morning to a cloudy sky.
Days like this make my heart feel heavy for no reason.

But when I think about it, don't we need cloudy days to appreciate sunny ones more?
Just like how difficult times make the good times feel more precious.

Today, I just keep going.
Tomorrow will be different.
